notes: NYI plays a conservative, low-event style with a strong trap.
They collapse aggressively to the net-front and protect the middle of the ice.
Offensive generation is modest but opportunistic off turnovers.

toronto_notes: Woll benefits from structured, low-event environments.
Prioritize clean sightlines and early box-outs on Anders Lee.
nyi_notes: Sorokin is capable of stealing games when Toronto over-passes.
Traffic and lateral screens are more effective than pure bar-down attempts.

forward_lines.objective: Win OZ possession and avoid high-risk neutral-zone turnovers.
notes: Keep Barzal to the outside on entries.
Force him to dump rather than carry across blue line with speed.

forward_lines.nyi_line: Lee/Nelson unit or secondary scoring line
forward_lines.objective: Grind down NYI D with sustained cycle shifts.
notes: Use Marner on the half-wall to exploit passing lanes behind the net.
Tavares and Pacioretty should live in the slot and crease.
Simplify: chip pucks deep and forecheck hard.
Crash the net for second and third chances.

forward_lines.nyi_line: Whoever has momentum or Barzal on defensive draws
notes: Use after goals and late in periods.
Prioritize clean DZ exits and safe line changes.
Tight gap at blue line but no over-commits.
Tanev owns the net-front; OEL handles retrievals and first pass.

defence_pairs.assignment: Nelson/Lee matchups and PP quarterback usage.
notes: Carlo locks down the slot while Rielly activates selectively on rushes.
Avoid both D deep below the tops of circles at the same time.

defence_pairs.assignment: Energy and physical tone-setting vs NYI depth.
notes: Deliver hits in NZ to slow Islanders’ forecheck.
Step up only when F3 is clearly high.

toronto: High-end finishing talent at the top of the lineup.
Stronger transition game if they avoid NYI’s trap lanes.
Elite PP capable of breaking the Passive Box with quick puck movement.
ny_islanders: Low-event trap structure that punishes sloppy Toronto neutral-zone play.
Net-front presence from Lee and heavy cycle ability.

notes: Toronto is the better team but must avoid playing into the Islanders’ trap.
Mental focus after a 7-1 win vs the same opponent is critical.
If Sorokin locks in and Toronto over-passes, game can tighten quickly.

start_of_game: First three shifts: simple north–south plays, glass-and-out preferred over cute middle plays.
Get pucks deep behind NYI D and finish checks.
after_goal_for: Deploy Kampf line to reset tempo when needed.
Next shift: manage puck conservatively and avoid odd-man rushes against.
after_goal_against: Keep same goalie unless threshold reached.
Shorten bench temporarily with top 6 and OEL–Tanev to stabilize.
late_game_lockdown: Protect Net + Collapsing, Close Support breakout only.
Kampf line with Tanev/Carlo for most DZ draws.
